column4: one question, there is some webserver automatically starting when i boot ubuntu, but i want to use apache (XAMPP)
how can i stop it? i even dont want it to start automatically, which webserver it is anyway...
ok im in Gnome, standard things
thank you ubottu
on the startup services i can't find a webserver, but there is one?
when i connect to http://localhost/ theres a "Its working!"
i tried close it with /etc/init.d/apache2 stop  it isnt running
^  that should show you which process is listening on port 80
sudo netstat -nap | grep ':80\>'
[sudo] password for patmat:
tcp6       0      0 :::80                   :::*                    LISTEN      2906/apache2
ah already know it, sorry
apache2 it is
so i should stop it with /etc/init.d/apache2 stop
/etc/init.d/apache2 stop

* Stopping web server apache2                                                                                                                apache2: Could not reliably determine the server's fully qualified domain name, using 127.0.1.1 for ServerName
[ OK ]
bash: /etc/init.d/apache2ctl: No such file or directory
!fr | tunisiano
httpd (pid 2906?) not running
ok i try something, now i should start xampp
You already stopped it when you did /etc/init.d/apache2 stop
